sn19.15:4.1: “Just now, Reverend, as I was descending from Vulture’s Peak Mountain I saw a scorched woman, sooty and sweaty, flying through the air.
sn19.15:4.3: “That woman used to be the king of Kaliṅga’s chief Queen.
sn19.15:4.4: She was of jealous nature, and poured a brazier of hot coals over her co-wife. …” …
